metadata.title: CVE-2017-18922 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
It was discovered that websockets.c in LibVNCServer prior to 0.9.12 did notproperly decode certain WebSocket frames. A malicious attacker couldexploit this by sending specially crafted WebSocket frames to a server,causing a heap-based buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18922` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2
libvncserver-config - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2
libvncserver1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2').
x11vnc package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
